questions.question: I ………………………….. he is not at home.
questions.description: That can be omitted after suppose.

questions.question: We hoped …………………………….
questions.description: We use a that-clause after hope.

questions.question: He ………………………………. that he has met your dad.
questions.description: Tell is used before a personal object.

questions.question: The teacher ………………………….. he was very busy.
questions.description: Tell is used before a personal object.

questions.question: She suggested …………………………………to the park.
questions.description: We use a that-clause after suggest.

questions.question: He ………………………………. me that he was coming on Sunday.
questions.description: We use tell before a personal object.

questions.question: I advised him …………………………….
questions.description: Advise can be followed by to + be + adjective.

questions.question: He promised us ………………………….. there at five.
questions.description: We use a that-clause after promise + object.

questions.question: Nobody knows when ………………………………. arrive.
questions.description: In indirect questions, the auxiliary verb goes after the subject.

questions.question: Tom could not figure out what …………………………… do next.
questions.description: In indirect questions, the auxiliary verb goes after the subject.

questions.question: He asked me ...............................................
questions.description: Ask can be followed by object + to-infinitive.

questions.question: They made him .............................................. for hours.
questions.description: Make + object is followed by infinitive without to.
